This game is certainly better than a lot of competitors, but it has drawbacks. The power creep is there. It feels awful to try and get a character you really like only for that character to be outclassed 1 patch later. The enemies in end game content are becoming increasingly difficult with high hp and damage that older characters have a harder time clearing. A lot of characters have useless eidolons, they don't make enough male characters, and they are not f2p friendly with 4 stars. Do better.

The game itself is good and has clearly been developed with a lot of love for the project. However, the powercreep has gotten very bad as of late, rapidly making characters obsolete and making you feel like you need to pull for all the new ones. You will have difficulty clearing even just the main story with older characters, not to mention the game's other modes that highly favor newer characters. I uninstalled because it started to feel bad and I didn't want to end up spending hundreds

It's been a good ride, but I can not forgive the recent choices made with the state of this game. the most recent story in 3.3 is probably the best they've done in a while. However, despite being story driven, the story is way too bloated in many areas that it doesn't have to be, those can be cut down and still have a great narrative experience because the story has interesting concepts that are hard to appreciate when the story telling is boring. as for characters? pull the new unit or suffer.

Edit: This game is literaly lying about in-game prices and chances for pulls, avoid like the plague new players! Great gameplay wise but at the end of the day it's gatcha garbage. Power creep is through the roof and unless you spend hundreds in the scummy low droprates for new op characters you can kiss any new content goodbye.

This is a game for children. Story lines are extremely basic, low effort, and predictable. The humor is meant for tiktok kids as well, and even they get sick of the same jokes after a while. As a Gacha it's also very unfriendly in the fact that it has some of the strongest dupes in the market, while also costing the most to obtain. You'd think that would stop powercreep but its actually the opposite. Your $2000 character is trash in comparison to the $2000 character released 2 months later.
Power creep power creep and more power creep. Your character want stay relevant more than 6 months

Played for 2 years. Quit the game with no intention of returning. Combat is stale, lacks depth and consists of auto-battling that will run you 10 minutes of ult-animations most days. Do not expect to get most characters through the gacha without spending. New events feel stiff, soulless and lack the charm of older ones. Obtaining upgrade mats and equipment will be your life. Genuinely, I would not recommend this game unless you want to be disappointed after catching up with the main story.

This game has been a standout experience since day one. Its compelling storytelling, strategic turn based combat, stunning art design, and generous reward system make it a top tier RPG. It's disheartening to see the recent smear campaign and influx of low ratings , which seem less about the game's quality and more about personal biases. The diverse and inclusive narratives are a strength, not a flaw. Let's appreciate the game for its rich content and the joy it brings to a wide audience.

Day 1 player here. I absolutely loved this game when it came out, and from 1.0 to 2.0, this game was magical, even with it's bumps here and there. It was honestly a 5* game. Ever since 2.1 this game has slowly become a big slog to me, both gameplay wise and story/character wise. Stopped playing with 3.0 when I tried to weather the storm thinking Amphoreus would be a change of scenery and pace. But with so much recasting and needing new characters, it is just unfun.

Fun gameplay, great character design. But the story feels very slow because of the continous yapping that sometimes makes it feel like it is being extended only to retain players longer. There is also a serious problem of powercreep with old characters like Seele. Which needs an extreme environment and stats to work.

Day 1 player here, I used to love the game but I'm starting to get fed up with the direction the game is going. Characters are cool but powercrept too quickly, after ~3-4 patches they fall off in damage, unless you're willing to pull for eidolons, their signature light cone (weapon) and/or their BiS teammates. Current story quest is very long with no skip dialogue button but a lot of yap. 2nd Anniv was a spending event thrown into your face. More issues but no more room to type.

Developers do not listen to players, they add predatory and toxic changes that the community is against just to sell the new characters. Castorice is a prime example; global passives that makes your account inferior if you do not own her, power creep is unreal. The events are boring and give little rewards, oh and the biggest crime of this game? is a lackluster story with constant yapping that STILL DOES NOT HAVE A SKIP BUTTON AFTER TWO YEARS OF DEVELOPMENT. 0.5/10 Do not play this, ever.

Honkai:Star Rail is a really engaging turn-based RPG with many good qualities: it has an easy to learn and simple battle system, interesting characters, unique puzzles and deep lore. The story concepts are also good but can fall at times when it's confusing, long or doesn't connect with other subplots well. Another thing is building your characters gives you a long-time goal and is easy with the auto button, but can feel annoying when you can't farm for longer periods at a time for okay rewards.

hoyoverse has genuinely fallen off. HSR used to be the better entry, but now the devs have made it so clear that they're not interested in making a player friendly game. HP inflation is insane, units are power crept within 2 patches, and older units have become completely obsolete. and don't get me started on the writing in the latest patches. convoluted for no reason, where decent ideas are not executed in compelling ways. they don't care about F2P. they don't care about you.

I enjoy this game. While it has been on a bit of a downward spiral, I am holding out hope that it learns from the player feedback and puts more effort into the story and gameplay instead of dialogue. I also hope they work on powercreep and the global passive, making sure that it doesn't entirely wipe out the effectiveness of older characters. I've had some great times on this game, so I'm holding out until I can no longer.

For prospective new players, be warned they are now starting to introduce account-wide buffs tied into limited/gacha character kits. What this means is your active 4-person team will be buffed by an inactive character outside of that team. This addition was neither desired nor necessary. It solves no problem. All it adds is increased fomo via a buff system that forever affect past and future characters. The door's now open. The precedent is set. Start playing at your own risk.

Insane amount of power creep which causes low spenders or free to play players struggle clearing endgame content, story has become lazy and way too long, and overall effort in making the game fun and interactive has been all gone with these recent patches. These recent updates have simply just not been fun for me. With the announcement of anniversary and the introduction of a character exclusive global passives, it opens the door for more FOMO.

Powercreep is an issue in most, if not all, gacha games, and this is the worst case so far. It's impossible to clear any main quests using old characters, and HP inflation is out of control. This pushes free-to-play players to spend on new characters just to continue the story, only for those characters to become powercrept after three to four updates. If they choose not to spend, like me, they will have a very hard time progressing through the main quests and will eventually quit.

Global passives in gacha games disrupt balance by favoring specific characters, limiting diverse/creative team building which is basically the building block of turn based game like hsr. this pressure players into chasing certain units to stay competitive, making the experience feel like pay-to-win rather than skillful gameplay. Casual players are often alienated by this system, eroding the community's vibrancy and diminishing creativity in team-building.

Honkai Star is a frustrating cash grab disguised as a game. The gacha rates are awful, making it nearly impossible to get good characters without spending tons of money, only for them to become obsolete due to power creep. Gameplay is repetitive, with shallow combat and an exhausting grind locked behind an energy system that limits progress. The story drags with excessive, unskippable dialogue. Monetization ruins the experience, proving it prioritizes profit over fun. Avoid this game entirely.

Honkai: Star Rail 3.0, is marred by significant issues that hinder player enjoyment. The absence of English voice lines already disrupts immersion, but the update also leans further into pay-to-win mechanics. Remember when farming was supposed to be challenging and rewarding? Now, with the purchase of the battle pass, players can lock two sub-stats, effectively removing a major grind element. Instead of improving the core gameplay loop, the update pushes monetization the expense of fairness.

This game can provide a pretty cool perspective on turn based combat with interesting mechanics. But it a can, not a guaranteed. To experience the game to its fullest you need a lot of luck. Its a gacha game. There's Luck in getting the characters you want, luck in getting the weapons, and luck in building the characters. And it's not just luck, the amount of resources they give you is quite low. And not to mention the amount of characters they shove out and the powercreep. It's annoying.

They tried to sell the story but they peaked too early and the story is now muddled in expositions n jargons. World building gets too much in the way of the main story instead of letting us players learn about it during gameplay. Spending too much time on learning about the bigger picture the delivery of the excellent main idea is going to fall flat. Just my opinion. Gameplay was fun at first. Repetitive design. It's big budgeted mid game. I know hsr could be better, but until then..

A really good premise damaged by the MiHoyo treatment. The gacha is way too stingy, and you get hardly any free pulls to tide you over. A good gacha should support true f2p, not just f2p with occasional splurges, which is what most people end up getting baited into being with a system as stingy as this. It also has other classic abusive tactics like a relic system where no relic is ever truly perfect, encouraging permagrind. The story is amazing and the combat is great! But it isn't worth this.

A central processing unit (CPU) is the main component of a computer. It's also known as the "central" or "main" processor. The CPU is the core of a computer system. It's the computer's brain, handling the assignment and processing of tasks, in addition to functions that make a computer run. The CPU is constantly following instructions from computer programs that tell it which data to process and how to process it.

Beautiful game and animations, pretty good story, fun battles and exploration, goofy and creative events and side quests that try out wildly different gameplay (resource management sims, puzzles, Phoenix Wright debate parodies, etc). Overall, the quality is AAA jRPG caliber, but it's free (as long as you don't fall into the gacha gambling trap). For a gacha, the daily log-in "chores" can be done in 2 minutes without even paying attention, and power creep is incredibly slow. A+, amazing game.

Probably the best example of how a freemium game should be. Nothing is locked behind paywalls. All characters and content can be acquired freely, and gacha currency is plentiful to free players. Even events can be played after the fact, reducing FOMO. The gameplay is just right for a mobile platform, mixing standard turn based combat with immediate interruptions using character's ultimates. The final boss fights of each story arc are absolutely show-stopping in their delivery and execution.

I recommend the 30 Day login purchase if you have a bit of money on the side for more Jades.

Decently fun, the story is nice! Blatantly, a cash grab, but that should be expected. Honkai has an mmorpg level story that's very well done. It's honestly one of the only reasons I still play. However, let's go over the negatives. Oftentimes, there is just so much clutter in side quests and character interactions that it can be overwhelming. The drop rates are abysmal 99% of the time. You can roll 80-100+ times and not get the banner hero. The rolls are astronomically expensive as well. 3/5.

The characters are awesome, and it does not require you to spam click like genshin or zzz. However, it is a bit hard to farm warp tickets if you are free to play, and you can't skip cutscenes. Other than that, it's really good and perfect for anime simps.

HSR is a turn based RPG with an interesting sci-fi setting and fun characters. It's a free to play game with a gacha system for gaining new characters. There are many aspects of this game that are amazing, particularly the art direction, music, and writing. There are also some aspects that aren't that great like farming equipment for your characters and the fact that it's a gacha game. If you like turn based combat and are fine with gacha games, this is a must try.

Simply the best turn-based RPG gacha around, and imho Hoyoverse's best. The graphics and character design are gorgeous, gameplay is engaging with lots of different modes, story is solid and the world engaging. Just a fantastic game, really fun and perhaps most importantly, it respects my time as a gamer. In a market saturated with gachas, it has become so valuable to me when a game respects my time and rewards my efforts accordingly.

They give you a free limited 5* and the gacha is decent if you plan your pulls.

It's the first turn-based gacha game I'm playing. Current Penacony updates are incredible. Good gameplay, great graphic. Overall, F2P can survive on this gacha game like Genshin. Still, the 50/50 will get you sick.

As the game updates, it somehow gets worse. Main quests're just...not clicking anymore. Penacony's unnecessarily long and the ending wasn't satisfying in any way. A lot of stuff to remember the story, too much information. How am i supposed to remember all of those? Plus, the relic rng. I think it is pretty obvious, it has the sh*ttiest system i've ever seen.Three flats with the repeating defense main stat??I need decent relics at least if i cannot get the characters i want. And lag got worse.

They should rename the game "just running around". Or longer "just running around,solving lame puzzles,engaging in even lamer unskippable dialogues". Farewell penacony reads like a 10th century novel and a dystopic social experiment not to puke outta boredom. Let us skip the torturous dialogues, I promise it will be the qol upgrade of the century and improve store rating. Code a game not a storybook which in any case reads 100x faster than this game

Largely, it's a great game, but the energy system could use an overhaul. 6 minutes to recover one energy with a max of 240, then 18 minutes to recover a single point in the backup reserve. Playing Honaki Star Rail is like herding cats in space. You think you're in control, but then the game throws you a curveball, and suddenly you're chasing space chickens in zero gravity. VERY grind heavy game. It gets 2 stars because of the good story, fun characters, and cool worlds, but 99% of your play time is just fighting the same enemies over and over again for materials/currency. The power creep is also significant, which means it's a never-ending race to grind enough to level up the newest characters to be able to clear anything. If you play for story, characters, lore, or exploration, that gets annoying real fast. But if you play to fight, you'll enjoy it.

Turn-based combat is widely regarded as a genre that emphasizes strategic gameplay. However, HSR's combat system appears to be limited to basic attacks, skills, and ultimate abilities. Furthermore, the strategic depth of the game seems to be heavily reliant on character abilities, which are obtained through gacha mechanics. This approach may limit the player's ability to develop and execute diverse strategies, as they may be restricted by the characters they have acquired.

I adore this game so much. The graphics, the characters, the storyline. Everything. Expect 2 things. 1) Character ascension. It's tedious. It's annoying. It's boring. And then you have to level up your characters immediately afterward. Otherwise, you did all of that for nothing. 2) The Xianzhou Luofu storyline. It lacks entertainment compared to Belobog and Penacony. It's still good, don't get me wrong. But it is by far the most boring. I hope to God that we don't revisit it in the future.
